summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer, , and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation. Those features have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer, IMFMediaEngine and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The VMRRenderPrefs enumeration type is used with the and methods to get and set basic rendering preferences.

member.name: VMRRenderPrefs.RenderPrefs_ForceOffscreen
member.summary: Indicates that the Video Mixing Renderer Filter 7 (VMR-7) should use only offscreen surfaces for rendering.

member.name: VMRRenderPrefs.RenderPrefs_ForceOverlays
member.summary: Indicates that the VMR-7 should fail if no overlay surfaces are available.

member.name: VMRRenderPrefs.RenderPrefs_AllowOverlays
member.summary: Indicates that the VMR-7 should use overlays if they are available. Should not be used by new applications.

member.name: VMRRenderPrefs.RenderPrefs_AllowOffscreen
member.summary: Indicates that the VMR-7 should use offscreen surfaces if no overlays are available. Should not be used by new applications.

member.name: VMRRenderPrefs.RenderPrefs_DoNotRenderColorKeyAndBorder
member.summary: Indicates that the application is responsible for painting the color keys.

member.name: VMRRenderPrefs.RenderPrefs_PreferAGPMemWhenMixing
member.summary: Indicates that the VMR-7 should attempt to use AGP memory when allocating texture surfaces.

member.name: VMRRenderPrefs.RenderPrefs_Mask
member.summary: Bitwise OR of all of the above flags.
